data.title: Guns in Movies, TV and Video Games
data.text:
The following guns were used in the British ITV television series Primeval:

Handguns

SIG-Sauer P226

Several SIG-Sauer P226 pistols are seen throughout the show.

SIG-Sauer P229

Captain Becker (Ben Mansfield) uses a SIG-Sauer P229 pistol.

Colt .22 Target Model

The "tranquilizer pistol", used by Abby Maitland (Hannah Spearritt), Connor Temple (Andrew Lee Potts) and Nick Cutter (Douglas Henshall) is a Colt .22 Target Model.

Beretta 92FS

Captain Wilder (Alex McSweeney) carries a Beretta 92FS pistol as his sidearm.

Beretta 92FS Inox

Stephen(James Murray) uses a Beretta 92FS Inox as his personal sidearm. He possesses at least two of these pistols. Helen Cutter also uses a Beretta 92FS Inox halfway through season 3.

Glock 17 (3rd Gen.)

London Police Officer Danny Quinn (Jason Flemyng) carries a 3rd generation Glock 17 as his sidearm.

Glock 17 (2nd Gen.)

When a future species of giant borrowing beetles prove to be able to resist the non-lethal EMD's effects, the ARC team decides to use some more conventional weapons stored in the ARC's armory, primarily several 2nd generation Glock 17 pistols.

Smith & Wesson 4046

Nick Cutter's clone uses a Smith & Wesson 4046 pistol.

Beretta Cougar

The Beretta Cougar makes occasional appearances throughout the show.

Webley Stinger Air Pistol

A season 3 promo still shows Jenny Lewis (Lucy Brown) holding a Webley Stinger Air Pistol. This weapon is never actually seen in the show.

Walther P99 (Walther Nighthawk)

Connor uses a Walther P99 in season 2, episode 3. The prop used is a Walther Nighthawk air pistol as a stand-in for a real P99.

Heckler & Koch USP

One of Helen Cutter's cloned soldiers uses a Heckler & Koch USP pistol in season 3.

Heckler & Koch USP (two-tone)

Nick Cutter (Douglas Henshall) uses a two-tone Heckler & Koch USP in season 2.

Walther P99

Ethan Dobrowski (Jonathyn Byrne) uses a Walther P99 during the season 4 finale. Unlike Connor's P99, this prop is either a blank-converted P99 or a blank-firing replica, as it locks open when Ethan empties his first magazine.

Cobra Big Bore Derringer

Henry Merchant (Stephen Hogan) uses a Cobra Big Bore Derringer. Seeing as Henry is from London 1867, this pistol is a stand-in for the Remington 1866 Derringer.

Submachine Guns

Heckler & Koch MP5

A large number of Heckler & Koch MP5 submachine guns are seen throughout the show, usually in the hands of Agency personnel.

Heckler & Koch MP5SD6

A few Heckler & Koch MP5SD6 submachine guns show up throughout the series.

Heckler & Koch MP5K

Some of the Agency's security forces carry Heckler & Koch MP5K submachine guns depending on where they are operating.

Heckler & Koch MP5SD3

Captain Becker uses a Heckler & Koch MP5SD3 during the Season 3 finale.

Heckler & Koch MP5K-PDW

In a continuity error in season 3, Episode 10, Becker's MP5SD3 turns into a Heckler & Koch MP5K-PDW after being broken by a Megopteran.

FN P90

Captain Wilder (Alex McSweeney), Christine Johnson's head of security, carries a FN P90 as his primary weapon.

Rifles

Heckler & Koch G36C

The Heckler & Koch G36C is commonly seen in the hands of the soldiers under the command of the Home Office and the ARC facility.

Heckler & Koch G36K

Some of the soldiers in the show occasionally use Heckler & Koch G36K carbines when in more open environments. These rifles are outfitted in the same manner as their G36Cs.

M4A1 Carbine

A large number of M4A1 Carbines are seen throughout the series in the hands of various government operatives. Most of these rifles are outfitted with railed handguards, flashlights, vertical foregrips, and red-dot sights.

SIG SG 552

Helen Cutter's clone soldiers in season 3 are armed with SIG SG 552 assault rifles.

Blaser R93 Sniper Rifle

One of the Anomaly researchers' heavier weapons is a Blaser R93 LRS2 Precision Sniper Rifle equipped with a Harris Bipod.

Accuracy International AWSM

Stephen has a Accuracy International AWSM sniper rifle in his weapons cache, although he never actually uses it onscreen.

Shotguns

Single-Barrel Breach-Load Shotgun

The Anomaly research team frequently uses a stainless-steel 12 gauge single-barreled breach-loading shotgun with black synthetic furniture, rails, Red Dot Sight, flashlight, and bipod. This gun, like others on the show, impersonates a tranquilizer gun. The ARC team possesses at least two of these weapons.

Side-by-Side Shotgun

A handful of civilians in more rural areas are seen using double-barreled shotguns. All of these are likely the same prop.

Armsel Striker

One of the SpecOps soldiers in the season 3 opener is armed with an Armsel Striker shotgun.

Mossberg 590 Cruiser

Captain Becker uses a Mossberg 590 Cruiser shotgun with a door-breaching muzzle brake during the third season.

Mossberg 500 Cruiser

When a future giant burrowing beetle proves resistant to the EMDs and forces the team to resort to conventional firearms, Becker uses a Mossberg 500 Cruiser with a silver finish.

Machine Guns

L110A1 (FN M249 Paratrooper)

The L110A1 (the British military issued FN M249 Paratrooper) light machine gun makes occasional appearances throughout the series.

Grenade Launchers

Madbull AGX Grenade Launcher

Captain Becker (Ben Mansfield) has what appears to be a short-barreled Heckler & Koch AG-C grenade launcher mounted to the handguard of his G36C. This prop is actually a Madbull AGX, an airsoft launcher that can be distinguished from a real AG-C due to it's short barrel and side clamping Picatinny rail mounting system.

M203

One of the Spec Ops soldiers in the season 3 opener is armed with a M4A1 carbine with and underbarrel M203 grenade launcher.

Other Weapons

Fictional Speargun

One of the ARC team's specialized weapons is a high-powered speargun.

Flamethrower

When a future fungus turns its host into a monster in the London underground, the ARC team tries to corner the creature with a number of flamethrowers.

Stun Grenade

Becker carries several unidentified grenades (referred to by Becker as "Stun Grenades").

Electro Muscular Disruption weapons

In season four, the ARC program is restructured and most of the weapons used by the ARC teams are retired to the armory and replaced with a fictional weapon series referred to as Electro Muscular Disruption weapons, or "EMD" for short (the EMD props appear to be built out of some sort of power tool, possibly a nail gun). The exact mechanics of these weapons are not elaborated on, but they are described as being similar in concept to a Taser in that their primary effect is to administer a strong electrical shock to whatever they hit. EMD shots also appear to have a kinetic effect on targets, as smaller creatures hit by an EMD are often sent reeling from the impact and the shots are capable of ricocheting off of flat metal surfaces. The power of each shot is widely adjustable, and there are four different EMD configurations seen in the show. All EMDs are outfitted with flashlights while in the field.

EMD Pistol

The smallest EMD variant is a basic pistol configuration, and is frequently used by both Abby (Hannah Spearritt) and Connor (Andrew Lee Potts) in place of their pistols from the previous seasons.

EMD Two-Handed Pistol

Similar to the pistol EMD variant, this EMD features a shortened barrel and lacks a stock, but features the vertical foregrip seen on larger EMD variants.

EMD Carbine

A medium-sized variant, this EMD features a short barrel (just a few inches longer than the EMD pistol barrel), two vertical foregrips, and a tube stock. This version is commonly seen in the hands of the various unnamed ARC soldiers.

EMD Rifle
